item.name: 1 vs. 100 Card Game
item.comment: Probably not a great game in and of itself if you don't like "home version" of game shows, but my wife and I quite like it as a fun way to pass a little time...it's got cards and it's got trivia, both things I like.

My wife and I are big card players and we both think that this is the ultimate card game, second to none. It's got it all, and the only thing we don't like is that we can't get four people together to play it every week.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: This actually seems to live up to the hype, I didn't think anything could do that. We have quite a lot of fun with it and I'm looking forward to playing some more, time will tell if it loses some of the luster after a few more plays.

item.name: Agricola Z-Deck
item.comment: Some nice cards, but all in all not something I think was good enough to add in very often, certainly not all of them. I guess we'll see with a few more plays.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: Traded in a math trade

item.name: BattleTech
item.comment: After many years, this is still my favorite board/miniatures game, I just wish I had more time to play it, and more people to play it with.

item.name: BattleTech: AeroTech
item.comment: I've always been a big fan of Battletech and this added some nice rules at the time.

item.name: BattleTech: Solaris VII – The Game World
Claustrophobia
item.comment: Really liked the game, but no one I played with quite felt the same...traded it to Darren for Fire & Axe.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark
item.comment: Only the miniatures

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
Condition: Opened and sorted but this copy has never been played. We always played other peoples copies and by time we got one we stopped playing.
Includes the Envoy and Black market promos.
Smoke free, pet free home.

item.name: Formula Dé Circuits 13 & 14: Montreal & Long Beach
Ghost Stories
item.comment: Great, great game. Very hard, but just makes us want to play more. The more we play, the better it gets cause we can see more strategies without panicking too much. :)

item.name: Groo: The Game
item.comment: This game is very luck based, but it's a whole lot of fun. If you're looking for hardcore strategy then look elsewhere, but if you want a nice light game that is great fun that you can play with gamers and non-gamers alike, this is the one for you.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: Really like it, but my wife...not so much. I mostly just play it on my ipod now.

item.name: Kahuna
item.comment: Played this quite a bit before I was logging plays. I like it, but I'm not very good at it and lose a lot, usually that doesn't stop me from wanting to play a game, but it seems to with this one.

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: Just not a hit with my wife, traded it away in a math trade for a $15 gift certificate.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: Pretty fun with the right group. Just a "take that" sort of card game with no real strategy, but with people that aren't into heavy games it can be a lot of fun.

item.name: Pandemic: On the Brink
item.comment: Made a great game even better. I don't think we'd ever even consider playing without this now.

item.name: Pyramid: Home Game
item.comment: Probably not a great game in and of itself if you don't like "home version" of game shows, but my wife and I quite like it as a fun way to pass a little time.

item.name: Ra
item.comment: Love it. Wasn't sure about a game that is nothing but auctions, but wow, does it ever work well.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment: Condition: Played but in excellent condition, the metal minis have been primed and one has been half painted, but it could easily be removed. The box has some shelf wear but no damage. Version: WotC Second edition

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Survivor
item.comment: This game is so bad, it's an insult to bad games everywhere.

item.name: Talisman
item.comment: Traded in a math trade to bmf0.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Thunderstone
item.comment: Excellent condition, this copy only played a couple of times.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: Sold in the marketplace.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
item.comment: Excellent condition, like new.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Dice Expansion
item.comment: I'm a big fan of most all of the Ticket to Ride stuff, and it's one of my wife's favourite games, but this one just didn't do it for us. It was way too quick, seemed like a waste to even set up the board it was over so quick. Plus you could grab 6 routes just to block someone...easily, that was pretty frustrating. All in all, not for us. Traded away in a math trade for $20 gift certificate.

item.name: UNO: The Simpsons – Special Edition Card Game
The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game
item.comment: Wow, this is a bad game. The board is totally pointless, you can play it with just the cards...and that's probably the only use for it, maybe to pass some time on a long road trip.
